posts.post_content:
Lemme see ... how fast can we do this in standard ..   
T1: Mountain  
T2: Forest, [Khalni Heart Expedition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Khalni Heart Expedition)  
T3: Forest, [Harrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harrow) (4 lands, 2 untapped), pop [Khalni Heart Expedition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Khalni Heart Expedition) (6 lands, 2 untapped), cast Dragonmaster Outcast if you didn't do it on your 1st turn.  
T4: Untap, get 5/5 dragon... [Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan) into [Valakut](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Valakut)?

posts.post_content: Raymond Swanland is excellent at making art conveying motion. This is a great 1 mana creature that isn't really a 1-drop, which is interesting use of design space. Kudos to Wizards for this one, which is both cool for the casual player, a challenge to keep alive for the seasoned player, and an abusable win condition for the player who plays to win..

I'd want to stick it into an [Intet, the Dreamer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intet, the Dreamer) EDH with [Dragon Roost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Roost), [Paradox Haze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paradox Haze), and [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season). posts.post_content: Like [Scute Mob](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scute Mob), it's an unassuming one-drop that can get very scary if your opponents can't deal with it in time (for twice the fun, try [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season), [Parallel Lives](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Parallel Lives), etc.). Strictly casual, but great fun nonetheless and very satisfying to pull off. This is what Mythics should be.

posts.post_content: Y'know, if someone uses removal on this, that's a *good* thing. It only cost you a single mana. Almost anything your opponent can do to it will still leave you ahead. [Terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terror), [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade), [Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat), [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate), [Journey to Nowhere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Journey to Nowhere)? You've spent a card and a mana; they've spent a card and two mana. Advantage: You. [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile)? They've spent a card and a mana; you've spent a card and a mana, and gotten a free land. Advantage: You. [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares)? Better, but they're still giving you a little advantage from that one life. And that's only if they have the removal immediately: If they don't, then you get some advantage from this just sitting around. If nothing else, it gives them one more reason to need to hold back blockers, or you'll be able to swing for a few extra points. And if it triggers even once before t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
